description: Lists all the resources in your Amazon Web Services account in this Amazon Web Services Region that are managed for zonal shifts in Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller, and information about them. The information includes the zonal autoshift status for the resource, as well as the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), the Availability Zones that each resource is deployed in, and the resource name.

nested_items.name: items
nested_items.description: The items in the response list.

nested_items.name: appliedWeights
nested_items.description: A collection of key-value pairs that indicate whether resources are active in Availability Zones or not. The key name is the Availability Zone where the resource is deployed. The value is 1 or 0.
(string) ---
(float) ---

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the managed resource.

nested_items.name: autoshifts
nested_items.description: An array of the autoshifts that have been completed for a resource.

nested_items.name: appliedStatus
nested_items.description: The appliedStatus field specifies which application traffic shift is in effect for a resource when there is more than one active traffic shift. There can be more than one application traffic shift in progress at the same time - that is, practice run zonal shifts, customer-initiated zonal shifts, or an autoshift. The appliedStatus field for a shift that is in progress for a resource can have one of two values: APPLIED or NOT_APPLIED. The zonal shift or autoshift that is currently in effect for the resource has an appliedStatus set to APPLIED.

nested_items.name: awayFrom
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone (for example, use1-az1) that traffic is shifted away from for a resource, when Amazon Web Services starts an autoshift. Until the autoshift ends, traffic for the resource is instead directed to other Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region. An autoshift can end for a resource, for example, when Amazon Web Services ends the autoshift for the Availability Zone or when you disable zonal autoshift for the resource.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: The time (UTC) when the autoshift started.

nested_items.name: availabilityZones
nested_items.description: The Availability Zones that a resource is deployed in.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the managed resource.

nested_items.name: practiceRunStatus
nested_items.description: This status tracks whether a practice run configuration exists for a resource. When you configure a practice run for a resource so that a practice run configuration exists, ARC sets this value to ENABLED. If a you have not configured a practice run for the resource, or delete a practice run configuration, ARC sets the value to DISABLED.

nested_items.name: zonalAutoshiftStatus
nested_items.description: The status of autoshift for a resource. When you configure zonal autoshift for a resource, you can set the value of the status to ENABLED or DISABLED.

nested_items.name: zonalShifts
nested_items.description: An array of the zonal shifts for a resource.

nested_items.name: appliedStatus
nested_items.description: The appliedStatus field specifies which application traffic shift is in effect for a resource when there is more than one active traffic shift. There can be more than one application traffic shift in progress at the same time - that is, practice run zonal shifts, customer-initiated zonal shifts, or an autoshift. The appliedStatus field for a shift that is in progress for a resource can have one of two values: APPLIED or NOT_APPLIED. The zonal shift or autoshift that is currently in effect for the resource has an appliedStatus set to APPLIED.

nested_items.name: awayFrom
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone (for example, use1-az1) that traffic is moved away from for a resource when you start a zonal shift. Until the zonal shift expires or you cancel it, traffic for the resource is instead moved to other Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: comment
nested_items.description: A comment that you enter for a customer-initiated zonal shift. Only the latest comment is retained; no comment history is maintained. That is, a new comment overwrites any existing comment string.

nested_items.name: expiryTime
nested_items.description: The expiry time (expiration time) for a customer-initiated zonal shift. A zonal shift is temporary and must be set to expire when you start the zonal shift. You can initially set a zonal shift to expire in a maximum of three days (72 hours). However, you can update a zonal shift to set a new expiration at any time.

nested_items.name: practiceRunOutcome
nested_items.description: The outcome, or end state, returned for a practice run. The following values can be returned:

nested_items.name: resourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier for the resource to include in a zonal shift. The identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource.

nested_items.name: shiftType
nested_items.description: Defines the zonal shift type.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: The time (UTC) when the zonal shift starts.

nested_items.name: zonalShiftId
nested_items.description: The identifier of a zonal shift.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: Specifies that you want to receive the next page of results. Valid only if you received a nextToken response in the previous request. If you did, it indicates that more output is available. Set this parameter to the value provided by the previous call's nextToken response to request the next page of results.
